item.title: A Guide to Scottish Delicacies for TGO Challengers
item.description: In 2014, I wrote a short guide to some of the Scottish food that Challengers from outwith Scotland may come across. I’ve now revised this and turned it into a more general guide in the food section. Scottish food has a bad reputation but, in the last 15 years or so, it has improved immeasurably, especially in Highland hotels and restaurants. If you eat in a reasonable restaurant, there’s every chance you will get a good meal.

item.title: Scottish Delicacies
item.description: I wrote this short guide to some ‘traditional’ Scottish food and drink for people planning a TGO Challenge - a cross country walk across Scotland, which I’ve done a few times. However, I think it may be of more general interest so I’ve extended it a wee bit and put it in the more general food section rather than the TGOC pages. I won’t write here about the excellent ‘high-end’ Scottish food such as venison and langoustines, that you might get in restaurants.
